result.execSummary:
The defendant Latasha E. McMath was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 10-03-2014 Court orders Deft. in lieu of balance of costs, 4 days RCJ consecutive to present sentence.

with huber, Stayed-Deft to call Diversion Office 373-3880 M-F 7am-3pm w/in 72 working hours or by 7-28-2014 for Report date w/in 75 days or no later than 10-4-2014. Failure to do so will result in issuance of a Commitment to Jail w/out Huber & new criminal charges
*9-26-2014  May serve in Dane or Rock County Per Judge Werner*
